reasoning: The transcription was carefully read to identify the specific actions taken to prepare the dish. Each action that contributes to the creation of the dish was considered a step. The steps were then organized in the order they were mentioned in the transcription, ensuring a logical sequence that would result in the final dish.
dish_description: The dish being prepared is a healthier version of French fries made in the oven. The potatoes are seasoned with paprika and herbs de Provence, cooked with peanut oil, and finished with a sprinkle of salt.

cooking_steps.description: Wash the potatoes, leaving the skin on if desired, and then thoroughly dry them using a towel or paper towel.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
Cut the potatoes into standard French fry shapes and ensure they are dry.
In a bowl, toss the cut potatoes with 2 to 3 tablespoons of peanut oil, ensuring they are evenly coated.
Season the oiled potatoes with about a teaspoon of Spanish paprika and herbs de Provence.
Spread the seasoned potatoes on a non-stick baking pan in a single layer.
Bake the potatoes in the preheated oven for approximately 45 minutes or until they are crispy and golden brown.
Remove the fries from the oven and immediately season them with salt to taste.
